title: (x) New Air France logo wide sans / similar to Gill Sans - custom by Brand Image - Desgrippes & Laga {Ben M}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202045922im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_6217.png)

Any idea what this font might be?

More pics [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202045922/http:/www.airliners.net/search/photo.search?aircraft_genericsearch=%3D%22airbus+a380%22&airlinesearch=%3A%28%22air+france%22+OR+%22%28air+france%29%22+OR+%22%28air+france%22+OR+%22%28air+france%29%29%22+NOT+%22aero-club%29%22+NOT+%22%28aero-club%22+NOT+%22aero-club%22+NOT+%22industries%22%29&countrysearch=&specialsearch=&daterange=&keywords=&range=&sort_order=photo_id+desc&page_limit=15&thumbnails=&searchSubmit=Searching%2C+please+wait...).
author: _bob

comments.content:
Dunno, Gill, mechanically expanded?  
Look at that sad leg on the "R". :-(

hhp

Here we go. It's custom type by [Brand Image - Desgrippes & Laga](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202045922/http:/www.brand-image.com/en/design-primary-tool-for-building-brands-airfrance.php)

I rather like the overindulgent flim-flam about their 'exclusive typography' and can't say I dislike the actual logotype. Hrant, on [closer inspection](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202045922/http:/corporate.airfrance.com/uploads/tx_templavoila/Airfrance_Skyteam_sans_ombre_02.jpg), the type seems pretty well designed, though rather plain.
